intro: Cryptantha exigua, commonly known as the smallflower cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as slopes and gravelly soils, and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the flowers are usually blue to purple in color, appearing in clusters. Cryptantha exigua is often found in open areas and is a common component of chaparral and scrub ecosystems.
